post.description: Tries to create a new order. Will work if the buyer has enough credit limit and payment terms for the given order. Once successfully created, the total amount of the order will be subtracted from the buyer's available credit limit.

subtotalAmountCents.description: The value of the order's goods and or services in cents.

estimatedDeliveryDateUTC.description: Estimated delivery UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

externalId.description: Internal order ID of the seller.

subtotalAmountCents.description: The value of the order's goods and or services in cents.

buyerFeesCents.description: This field will automatically be calculated. It will have a non-zero value when the seller is configured to charge fees to buyers. Note that this value is already included in the total amount cents.

totalAmountCents.description: Total amount in cents. This amount includes buyer fees if applicable. The value of the to-be-created invoice should equal this amount.

paymentTermDays.description: Payment term in days. The maturity date of the to-be-created invoice should equal the payment term days added to the order creation date.

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: Estimated delivery UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: Creation UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

buyerFeesCents.description: This field will automatically be calculated. It will have a non-zero value when the seller is configured to charge fees to buyers. Note that this value is already included in the total amount cents.

totalAmountCents.description: Total amount in cents. This amount includes buyer fees if applicable. The value of the to-be-created invoice should equal this amount.

paymentTermDays.description: Payment term in days. The maturity date of the to-be-created invoice should equal the payment term days added to the order creation date.

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: Estimated delivery UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: Creation UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

get.description: Gets an order by CrediPay's internal order ID.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: CrediPay's internal order ID.

externalId.description: Internal order ID of the seller.

subtotalAmountCents.description: The value of the order's goods and or services in cents.

buyerFeesCents.description: This field will automatically be calculated. It will have a non-zero value when the seller is configured to charge fees to buyers. Note that this value is already included in the total amount cents.

totalAmountCents.description: Total amount in cents. This amount includes buyer fees if applicable. The value of the to-be-created invoice should equal this amount.

paymentTermDays.description: Payment term in days. The maturity date of the to-be-created invoice should equal the payment term days added to the order creation date.

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: Estimated delivery UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: Creation UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

post.description: Moves an order to finalized state. Status for indicating the order is ready to be processed by the seller, and the goods will be delivered. After an order is finalized, you will be able to attach an invoice to it.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: CrediPay's internal order ID.

externalId.description: Internal order ID of the seller.

subtotalAmountCents.description: The value of the order's goods and or services in cents.

buyerFeesCents.description: This field will automatically be calculated. It will have a non-zero value when the seller is configured to charge fees to buyers. Note that this value is already included in the total amount cents.

totalAmountCents.description: Total amount in cents. This amount includes buyer fees if applicable. The value of the to-be-created invoice should equal this amount.

paymentTermDays.description: Payment term in days. The maturity date of the to-be-created invoice should equal the payment term days added to the order creation date.

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: Estimated delivery UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: Creation UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

409.description: Could not finalize order. Order could be already finalized OR is not in accepted state.

post.description: Moves an order to cancelled state and increases the buyer's available credit limit by that order's total amount. If the order already has an invoice linked to it, it will be fully refunded.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: CrediPay's internal order ID.

externalId.description: Internal order ID of the seller.

subtotalAmountCents.description: The value of the order's goods and or services in cents.

buyerFeesCents.description: This field will automatically be calculated. It will have a non-zero value when the seller is configured to charge fees to buyers. Note that this value is already included in the total amount cents.

totalAmountCents.description: Total amount in cents. This amount includes buyer fees if applicable. The value of the to-be-created invoice should equal this amount.

paymentTermDays.description: Payment term in days. The maturity date of the to-be-created invoice should equal the payment term days added to the order creation date.

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: Estimated delivery UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: Creation UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

409.description: Could not cancel order. Order could be already cancelled OR is not in any of the following states [created, accepted, finalized, rejected].

get.description: Gets all documents linked to an order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: CrediPay's internal order ID.

maturityDate.description: Asset maturity date in ISO 8601 format

dueDate.description: Invoice due date in ISO 8601 format. In the case of multiple installments, this is the due date of the last installment.

post.description: Gets the invoice amounts and the total fees for the possible order.

404.description: Buyer or seller was not found.

409.description: Seller is not linked to application or the payment term days is invalid.

post.description: Refunds an order. When this endpoint is called, the amount CrediPay charges the buyer will be reduced by the amount passed in the body. This will then be subtracted from the next disbursement the seller receives.

value.description: Refund value in cents. This property is deprecated use refundValueCents in body instead

externalId.description: Internal order ID of the seller.

subtotalAmountCents.description: The value of the order's goods and or services in cents.

buyerFeesCents.description: This field will automatically be calculated. It will have a non-zero value when the seller is configured to charge fees to buyers. Note that this value is already included in the total amount cents.

totalAmountCents.description: Total amount in cents. This amount includes buyer fees if applicable. The value of the to-be-created invoice should equal this amount.

paymentTermDays.description: Payment term in days. The maturity date of the to-be-created invoice should equal the payment term days added to the order creation date.

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: Estimated delivery UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: Creation UTC date in ISO 8601 format.

post.summary: Extends payment terms for an order
post.description: Extends payment terms for an order for the given asset

requestBody.description: Number of days to extend the payment terms and the asset id for which the payment terms are to be extended.

numberOfDays.description: Number of days for extending the payment terms.

assetId.description: Id of the asset to be extended

get.description: Lists all installments (assets) linked to your account. This endpoint is deprecated, use /installments instead.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the installments to filter by.

parameters.name: assetStatus
parameters.description: assetStatus Status of the installments to filter by.

parameters.name: collectionStatus
parameters.description: Collection Status of the installments to filter by.

parameters.name: settledAtFromDate
parameters.description: Filter installments (assets) settled after this date. Can be used together with settledAtToDate to query a date-range.

parameters.name: settledAtToDate
parameters.description: Filter installments (assets) settled before this date. Can be used together with settledAtFromDate to query a date-range

id.description: Credipay's internal installment (asset) ID. UUID v4 format.

settledAt.description: The date, in UTC ISO 8601 format, when the amounts were paid to CrediPay.

maturityDate.description: The date, in UTC ISO 8601 format, when the asset is expected to be paid.

invoice.description: The invoice that originated this installment (asset)

invoiceNumber.description: Invoice number. It can be the seller's internal invoice ID.

get.description: Lists all installments (assets) linked to your account.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the installments to filter by.

parameters.name: assetStatus
parameters.description: assetStatus Status of the installments to filter by.

parameters.name: collectionStatus
parameters.description: Collection Status of the installments to filter by.

parameters.name: settledAtFromDate
parameters.description: Filter installments (assets) settled after this date. Can be used together with settledAtToDate to query a date-range.

parameters.name: settledAtToDate
parameters.description: Filter installments (assets) settled before this date. Can be used together with settledAtFromDate to query a date-range

id.description: Credipay's internal installment (asset) ID. UUID v4 format.

settledAt.description: The date, in UTC ISO 8601 format, when the amounts were paid to CrediPay.

maturityDate.description: The date, in UTC ISO 8601 format, when the asset is expected to be paid.

invoice.description: The invoice that originated this installment (asset)

invoiceNumber.description: Invoice number. It can be the seller's internal invoice ID.

get.description: Retrieve a list of buyers, each with their credit limits and seller configurations. Seller configurations include settings specific to the relationship between each buyer and seller. There is an optional parameter 'sellerTaxId'. If 'sellerTaxId' is provided, the response includes seller configurations for the specified seller only. If no 'sellerTaxId' is provided, the response includes seller configurations for all sellers associated with the API key. This endpoint allows customization of data retrieval, enabling a focus on either a specific seller or configurations for all linked sellers.

parameters.name: sellerTaxId
parameters.description: Tax Id of the seller. It is used to filter the seller configurations defined for each buyer. If not provided the seller configurations for all sellers linked to the application are returned.

taxId.description: The tax ID of the company

onboarded.description: Whether or not the buyer has completed the onboarding

eligible.description: Whether or not the buyer is eligible for credit

get.description: Retrieve a single buyer with their credit limits and seller configurations. Seller configurations include settings specific to the relationship between the buyer and seller. There is an optional parameter 'sellerTaxId'. If 'sellerTaxId' is provided, the response includes seller configurations for the specified seller only. If no 'sellerTaxId' is provided, the response includes seller configurations for all sellers associated with the API key. This endpoint allows customization of data retrieval, enabling a focus on either a specific seller or configurations for all linked sellers.

parameters.name: taxId
parameters.description: Tax Id of the buyer.

parameters.name: sellerTaxId
parameters.description: Tax Id of the seller. It is used to filter the seller configurations defined for the buyer. If not provided the seller configurations for all sellers linked to the application are returned.

taxId.description: The tax ID of the company

onboarded.description: Whether or not the buyer has completed the onboarding

eligible.description: Whether or not the buyer is eligible for credit

post.description: Allows you to submit a Nota Fiscal XML file. If orderId is not provided, a new order is created. If orderId is provided, the invoice is linked to the specified order. For an invoice to be accepted, it needs to be within the buyer's available credit limit and maximum payment terms.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: CrediPay's internal order ID. UUID v4 format. If provided the uploaded invoice will be linked to this order.

requestBody.description: Nota Fiscal XML file. Needs to have been processed and approved by SEFAZ (draft XMLs are not allowed).

id.description: Credipay's internal invoice ID. UUID v4 format.

invoiceNumber.description: Invoice number. Extracted from the NF-e.

dueDate.description: Invoice due date in ISO 8601 format. In the case of multiple installments, this is the due date of the last installment.

issuanceDate.description: Invoice issuance date in ISO 8601 format. Extracted from the NF-e.

fundedAt.description: Funded date in ISO 8601 format. Defaults to null if the installment has yet to be funded.

settledAt.description: Settled date in ISO 8601 format. Defaults to null if the installment has yet to be settled.

disbursedAmountCents.description: Disbursed amount cents. Defaults to 0 if no disbursement has been made.

latestRefundDate.description: Latest refund date in ISO 8601 format. Defaults to null if the installment has not been refunded.

dueDate.description: Invoice due date in ISO 8601 format. In the case of multiple installments, this is the due date of the last installment.

repaymentDate.description: Repayment date in ISO 8601 format. Defaults to null if the repayment has yet to be made.

order.description: The order associated with this invoice

400.description: Could not process the invoice XML due to a format error.
